author: sky.cactus
content: Something with a commit-reveal scheme for transaction submission.

author: sky.cactus
content: You would submit your transaction with payment information, bet no transaction details, then after order is established you would submit the details.

author: sky.cactus
content: The problem is that this makes censorship attacks more powerful as it allows an attacker to cost the sender money by censoring the transaction body.

author: potuz
content: another problem is that you need to penalize not submitting the details afterwards. There are ways having the transaction to automatically decrypt after a while. But still it becomes technically a hassle to implement a scheme where transactions go encrypted. It also adds latency to the market and on wild swings where the standard tool is to stop and form a book, it delays this as well.

author: sky.cactus
content: Have the user pay for the transaction in the commit, regardless of whether it was revealed.

author: sky.cactus
content: However, I agree that this solution is not without problems.

author: 0xsadcat
content: I think some level of centralization is ok here, because the worst case is mev extraction. So it could work by using a sgx-based sequencer. Even if there's a new sgx hole and it's exploited for a while, new microcode updates would fix it. Users could verify that the sequencer they are sending transactions to is running the last version of sgx.

author: steve.eth
content:
Anyone know of any existing wallet manager software, like https://gnosis-safe.io/,  that allows a team to enforce time delays before you can transfer tokens? This would make it publicly on chain and obvious to the token's community that a transfer has been initialized so there is no surprise that tokens have been transferred or market sold later. 

For example:  a significant amount of the supply is in this custom wallet, managed by the team. If we wanted to transfer out let's say 10,000 tokens , we would have to call the "initialize" on chain call and pass in 10,000 as a value that would unlock 10,000 tokens in 1 week from now, assuming the built in time delay is 1 week.  After waiting 1 week, now we have 10,000 tokens unlocked available for transfer.
